DOC.HEAD: Mrs. Quayle Suggests Use of Morning After Pill for Rape Victims
DOC.TEXT: Marilyn Quayle said rape victims should be allowed to abort a pregnancy, and in such cases she supported use of a French morning after pill. The use of the pill, known as RU486, has been strongly fought in the United States by anti-abortion groups. Mrs. Quayle, wife of Vice President Dan Quayle, made her comments in an interview Sunday on the use of a pill. Her statements apparently contradict comments she made on the issue last week. Mrs. Quayle said in a letter Thursday to John C. Willke, president of the National Right to Life Committee, ``I do not support any medical procedures or pills other than those that actually prevent pregnancy.'' Willke wrote her asking for a clarification of her position on the issue. In the letter, it was not clear whether she was referring to contraceptive pills or other pills, including RU486. ``I think that anyone who is raped should report it absolutely immediately, and every step should be taken to insure that a pregnancy has not occurred,'' Mrs. Quayle told the Daily News. ``Something like the French morning after pill, if proven effective, would be very appropriate and would lessen the psychological trauma of a rape victim,'' she said. RU486 is a synthetic chemical that causes an abortion by inducing the uterus to expel the egg.
